New York.passage: The Empire State Building is an American Art Deco landmark located in Midtown Manhattan. It was built during the Great Depression between 1930 and 1931, and is now owned and managed by the Empire State Realty Trust. At 1,454 feet (437 m) tall, it is one of the world's tallest buildings and is the 10th-most-tall structure in the city. Construction began in 1930, a year after the Wall Street Crash in 1929, which resulted in the collapse of many banks and businesses. The Empire State Building's height was not an especially unusual feature during this period, as it was only about half a foot taller than the other skyscrapers at the time. The building is characterized by a bronze eagle statue atop its pinnacle. The eagle's head, wings and feet are depicted in relief, which are gilded in copper with a gold lustre and standing atop an oval plaque with the inscription "This is a land of opportunity". The building's main entrance is located on the east side and is flanked by two grand marble staircases. The facade of the building is constructed of Indiana limestone, and is covered in terra cotta tiles. The Empire State Building is one of New York City's most recognizable landmarks, and is now a cultural center, with restaurants, retail shops, offices, hotels, and residential apartments.

In February 1984, the first of the Koseikan (Koseikan East) trainsets made their test run, running between Narita and the Koseikan East base in Yokosuka. The first Koseikan train (Koseikan No. 5) started running on December 16, 1984, from Yokohama to Koshigoe (Nagoya) via Atami and Odaizumi. The trainset was followed by 11 more, all of which started running between Tokyo and the Yokosuka and Nagoya base in March 1987, and by the end of that year, 4 trains had started connecting Osaka and Omiya (Yamagata) via at-then-current Nankai Electric Railway's Yamagata East line. London.passage: (London, England), the capital and largest city of the United Kingdom, situated on the River Thames, in the South East of England. It is the centre of a metropolitan area with a population of more than 8.6 million, making it one of the world's most populated cities. London is a unique combination of history and culture, with a long recorded history that is thousands of years old. The Romans and Celtic tribes were the first to live in London, and they were replaced by the Vikings in the ninth century. London is now an international city and financial centre. London is home to several important institutions, such as the British Library, Tate Modern, Imperial College London, London Business School, The British Museum, and many others. It is also home to many theatres, museums, and iconic landmarks such as Big Ben and the London Eye. The city is often known as the Big Smoke due to its large number of smoky chimneys. London is situated on the River Thames. The area that is now London was originally inhabited by various Celtic tribes. The Romans built London in AD 50 and called it Londinium, meaning "the place where the Romans have been." The city was renamed Londinium later, and the name has evolved since then, being referred to as "Londinum," "Londinium," and "London." London has a long recorded history, with a recorded history of thousands of years old.

California.passage: "California, officially the State of California (Californie or the State of Californie), is a state located on the West Coast of the United States of America. California is the most populous state in the country, and is also home to the second-most populous metropolitan area in the world. The state's population of 39.25 million makes it the third-most populous in the nation. It is the only state in the contiguous United States where the population exceeds 4 million. California is the most diverse state in the country, with more than 100 languages spoken there. The state is also home to the world's largest economy, the California economy. California is the 12th-largest in the world, with a GDP of US$1.4 trillion in 2006. California is home to more Fortune 500 companies than any other state, 6 of which are located in Silicon Valley. The San Francisco Bay Area, which includes the cities of San Francisco, San Jose and Oakland, is home to 12 Fortune 500 companies. The Golden State is home to the world's third-largest entertainment industry and is the birthplace of Hollywood, the largest film production center in the world. In addition, California has the world's second-most populous port in Long Beach.

qae_pairs.explanation: The worlds second-largest film production center is located in Long Beach, California.

the East Side Gallery.passage: The East Side Gallery, is a wall along the Berlin Wall that is painted with murals by various international artists depicting events of the Cold War. It is located in Berlin, Germany, on the eastern side of the former Wall, and was declared a UNESCO World Heritage Site in 2004. My daughter, who is a history student, was studying this wall the other day. Her class had watched a video about it and she brought home a pamphlet about it. The wall is 1.6 km long and stands at 9.1 metres high. The wall was built in 1961 and is no longer a deterrent for people leaving East Germany. The wall, and all that was on it, was ripped down a few months before the fall of the Berlin Wall in 1989. This was my first photo I have used of the East Side Gallery and I'm impressed.

Tokyo.passage:
(Note that this is an older version and has now been updated. You can find the newer one here: )
Tokyo (東京 "Tokyo"; Japanese 京都 [kyoan] ) is the capital and largest city of Japan, located in Tokyo Bay in the Kanto region. Tokyo's population exceeds 13.5 million, making it the most populous city in the world, though it has recently passed Istanbul for the title of the most populous metropolitan area in Europe. The Tokyo metropolitan area is the largest metropolitan area in the world by population and area, with a population of over 37 million, including over 23 million in Tokyo. Tokyo is home to the world's busiest station, Tokyo Station, located in Shinjuku, Tokyo, and serves over 1.2 billion passengers per year. Tokyo is Japan's most urbanized city. Tokyo's metropolitan area has 37.7 million people, the largest population of any metropolitan area in the world. Tokyo has three major rail networks: the Tokyo Metro (the main subway system), JR East (a long-distance railway company) and Toei (a light rail network). Tokyo is the most populous city in the world, with an estimated population of 13.5 million in 2005.
